title: Why do people end a sentence with the word “right”? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hello! As an editor at TextRanch, I would be glad to answer your question. People use “right?” at the end of sentences to seek reassurance that the listener is agreeing with them or understanding the point that they are making. It is very often used when the speaker is explaining a concept or telling a story. Further, let me give you a few examples: That math test was really difficult, right? So I was on vacation last summer, right? There are only so many ways to make an omelette, right? Your dad is an engineer, right? You know the answer to the question, right?

It’s called “speech disfluency.” People use certain sounds, words, or phrases to fill the gaps in conversation. These sounds, et. al., can become habitual, to the point people use them without realizing it. For some people, that means frequently ending their sentences with “know what I mean?” even when they’re not asking a question. The same could be the case for someone who frequently uses “right” at the end of their sentences.
